Question: As it was not possible to read mathematics there at the time, this person decided to study physics and chemistry.
Hints: Police investigations took place, but were closed as this person refused to make a complaint.
On their return to England, this person attended Radlett School for a year and from September 1952, St Albans School.
One of those employed was Elaine Mason, a vivacious woman who was to become this person's second wife.
